fields.description: Crucible reviews are public by default, which probably should be changed or at least made more public.

fields.description: We need a way to remove a project.  We've found that by removing the project in subversion, you can basically kill Fisheye.
fields.summary: Remove project

fields.description:
* Improve success screen. MK to spec
* Clarify distinction between Subversion tree and FishEye repository
* As per AOD-376, need to clearly identify SVN url
* Use redirects to prevent CreateStudio.jspa page reloading (this probably needs a separate ticket)


From Scott:
Improve success screen for creating a project.  4 large green bars are kind of confronting.

when creating a project - link to 'subversion' repository and source repository is kind of redundant?  What is the difference?  Why don't I have one page with nice links to 'view your source' 'import your source'.

Also - I could reload this screen (http://labs.atlassian.com/secure/admin/CreateStudio.jspa?pid=10036) and it seems like my project in JIRA was successfully created, but not creation of the space.  You should use redirects to prevent page reloading

Note: MK to spec first. Will spec this iteration for potential implementation next iteration.
fields.summary: improve success screen for creating a project

fields.summary: Default wiki permissions should allow anyone to see the space

fields.description:
I just logged in to http://labs.atlassian.com/.  I first typed the wrong username/password combination.  When I corrected it, I *didn't* select 'Remember Me' and logged in successfully.  I then clicked on the wiki tab and was asked for a login again.  

I think that's a fairly crappy user experience, as it's all really just one big application to the user.
fields.summary: Login without 'Remember me' set requires another login when browsing to the wiki tab

fields.description:
List of the projects in a dropdown comes from Jira. Hence all the project keys and links are generated from Jira regardless of what current application is.
We should fix it and for each Jira application we should find associated key for local project/space/repository

fields.description: We need an upgrade framework to use to migrate existing studio instances to new configuration.  This will probably be a new plugin that will try to enact configuration changes on startup.
fields.summary: Upgrade framework

fields.description:
The plugins should be grouped under 'studio-theme' and 'applinks' to make it easier to do releases and track.  The resulting SVN layout will be:

applinks/(trunk|tags|branches)
  applinks-confluence-plugin
  applinks-jira-plugin
  applinks-fisheye-plugin
  applinks-core
  applinks-client

studio-theme/(trunk|tags|branches)
  studio-theme-confluence-plugin
  studio-theme-jira-plugin
  studio-theme-fisheye-plugin
  studio-theme-static-plugin

studio-functional-tests/(trunk|tags|branches)

user-counter-plugin/(trunk|tags|branches)
fields.summary: Consolidate plugins to facilitate easier releases

fields.description: The default breadcrumbs colour is light grey on a white background, which is difficult to read.
fields.summary: Breadcrumbs default colour difficult to read

fields.description:
Breadcrumbs are currently a light colour on a light background, making them difficult to read. The colour of breadcrumbs doesn't change when the colour scheme is updated.

To duplicate this problem change the breadcrumbs colour in the colour scheme manager in confluence. The colour will be updated in the manager, but the actual colour of the crumbs will not.
fields.summary: Breadcrumbs colour can't be configured in Confluence

fields.summary: Use trusted apps for navbar calls

fields.description:
In our fireball, we need support for upgrades.  From contegix:

Ideally, if a common "Upgrade only" build.properties file could 
propagate the crowd.properties and confluence.home values, perhaps other 
items in the future, this would be ideal. Then just a single step during 
the upgrade would be to run the build.properties once the new versions 
have been symlinked in.

This would also make finding configuration details for a given instance 
a piece of cake, minimizing the "missed files" problems.
fields.summary: Add support for upgrades to fireball script

fields.description: Disable public signup on default configuration of Conf & JIRA
fields.summary: Disable public signup on default configuration of Conf & JIRA

fields.description:
1. Is the page to add new projects called, 'Add New Project', 'Add a New Project' or 'Create New Project'? Different terms used in the page title versus on the page itself.

2. Are we using the term 'Global Icon' or 'Logo'? (prefer the former). Not consistent in UI. 'Global Icon' used on Studio Administration page, whereas 'Logo' used on 'Edit Look and Feel Configuration' page

3. Suggestion: 'Edit Look and Feel Configuration' is too wordy. Perhaps abbreviate to 'Edit Look and Feel'.

4. Suggestion: On the Studio Administration page, the links are not descriptive enough. The 'change' link under the Global Icon actually links to a page to change the look and feel, not just the global icon. The 'change' link next to Account Name actually links to a page to change account level settings not just account name. Consider putting the links elsewhere and/or renaming?
fields.summary: UI Review Comments

fields.description: Crucible keys are indistinguishable from JIRA keys, so we should prefix all crucible keys with CR.  Therefore, if the JIRA project is CONF-123, then the Crucible project key would be CRCONF-123

fields.description: Studio plugins, particularly Studio Navbar JIRA Plugin, should be protected under sysadmin permission. This can be done by modifying the 'is system plugin' (or something like that) to true.
fields.summary: Protect Studio plugins under sysadmin permission

fields.description: The default implementation of WebLink in Confluence only allows for linking to the current context used for Confluence. For JIRA Studio, we will need to change the BaseUrl to link to JIRA and Fisheye. A custom class provided to the WebItem descriptor can overwrite the default link and change the BaseUrl accordingly.
fields.summary: Improve WebLinks in Confluence to allow for customizing the baseURL

fields.description: Currently, it takes quite a while to get a successful JIRA Studio build from scratch.  From missing dependencies to projects not checked out, we need to make this process smoother, especially if we are going to be bringing on new developers.
fields.summary: Improve the JIRA Studio build

fields.description:
We need to create a JIRA Studio-specific version of the JIRA Fisheye Plugin.  From Tim, the instructions are:

-- 
The properties files that will need to be search/replaced for your special Cohotion release sit at:

http://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/contrib/jira/jira-fisheye-plugin/trunk/src/main/resources/com/atlassian/jira/ext/fisheye/fisheye-panels.properties (issue / project tab panels)
http://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/contrib/jira/jira-fisheye-plugin/trunk/src/main/resources/com/atlassian/jira/plugin/web/fragment/fisheye/fisheye_webfragment.properties (web fragments)
http://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/contrib/jira/jira-fisheye-plugin/trunk/src/main/resources/com/atlassian/jira/portal/portlets/fisheyerecentcommits.properties (portlet)
http://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/contrib/jira/jira-fisheye-plugin/trunk/src/main/resources/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/admin/AssociateFishEyeRepositories.properties (config screens)
http://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/contrib/jira/jira-fisheye-plugin/trunk/src/main/resources/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/admin/ViewFishEyeConfiguration.properties (config screens)

You could either check out and build your own release or just modify the files in the existing JAR.
-- 

This process should be documented in a proper wiki page.
fields.summary: Create JIRA Studio-specific version of the JIRA Fisheye plugin

fields.description:
Fisheye has a concept of linkers - strings that match given regular expression become url links
We need to configure these linkers for each new repositories. Also if we change configuration of Application Links instances, we need to go thru existing repositories and update linkers
See also http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/HS/Link+Syntax for links syntax
fields.summary: Set up linkers in Fisheye repositories

fields.description:
We need a modified version of our functional test fireball to include:
 * production product backup files
 * A readme document to describe how to install
 * special tokens in key configuration files and instructions how to replace them for production
fields.summary: Create production fireball

fields.description:
We need a standard operating procedure (SOP) document to describe significant studio tasks and how they will be completed between Atlassian and Contegix.  This document should describe common scenarios, detailing who does what and in what steps.  Processes to cover:
 * Creating an instance
 * Upgrading all instances to a new JIRA Studio version
 * Removing an instance
 * Migrating an instance from one box to another
 * Handling high load from a user
fields.summary: Write SOP for contegix hosting
